contentrichtext.text: {{Notability|date=December 2012}} '''Frances Joan "Fran" Brill''' (born September 30, 1946) is an American actress and puppeteer, best known for her roles on ''[[Sesame Street]]'' and playing Lily Marvin in the [[Frank Oz]] film, [[What About Bob?]]. Brill was born in [[Chester, Pennsylvania]], the daughter of Linette and Joseph M. Brill. Her father was a physician.<ref>[http://www.filmreference.com/film/49/Fran-Brill.html Fran Brill Film Reference biography]</ref> She is a graduate of [[Boston University Fine Arts School]]. Married to Francis Robert Kelly. She began her career in theater, making her [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]] debut in the 1969 play ''[[Red, White and Maddox]]''. Her other [[theater|theatrical]] roles include leads at the [[Roundabout Theatre Company|Roundabout Theatre]], [[Manhattan Theater Club]], [[Playwrights Horizons]] and many [[region]]al theaters including the [[Long Wharf Theatre|Long Wharf]], [[Yale Repertory Theatre]], [[Arena Stage]], the [[Mark Taper Forum]] and the [[Actors Theatre of Louisville]]. She has been nominated twice for a [[Drama Desk Award]], for ''[[What Every Woman Knows]]'' (1976) and for ''[[Knuckle (play)|Knuckle]]'' (1981), respectively. From 1974-1975, Brill played Fran Bachman on [[NBC]]'s [[daytime drama]] ''[[How to Survive a Marriage]]''. Her character struggled with sudden [[widow]]hood, and Brill received over a thousand [[condolence]] [[Letter (message)|letter]]s. Brill was also featured in [[episode]]s of ''[[The Guiding Light]]'', ''[[All My Children]]'', ''[[The Edge of Night]]'', ''[[Hyde in Hollywood]]'', ''[[Lip Service]]'' and ''[[Kate and Allie]]''. She has also [[guest star|guest-starred]] on [[nighttime]] [[drama]]s such as ''[[Third Watch]]'', ''[[Against the Law (TV series)|Against the Law]]'', ''[[Law & Order]]'', and ''[[Law & Order: SVU]]''. On ''[[Sesame Street]]'', for which she has won an [[Emmy Award]], she has created and puppeteered the [[The Muppets|Muppets]] called Zoe, [[Little Bird]], and [[Prairie Dawn]], among others. Playing Zoe, Brill appeared on the [[TV-series]] ''[[The West Wing]]'' as well as many [[home videos]] including ''[[Zoe's Dance Moves]]''. With [[the Muppets]] she also did ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'', ''[[The Muppet Show]]'', ''[[The Jim Henson Hour]]'', ''[[Dog City]]'', and ''[[The Adventures of Elmo in Grouchland]]''. She has also been seen and heard in hundreds of [[commercials]] and appeared in such films as ''[[What About Bob?]]'', ''[[Midnight Run]]'', ''[[City Hall]]'' and ''[[Being There]]''. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{IMDb name|id=0109329|name=Fran Brill}} *{{IBDB name|id=92653|name=Fran Brill}} *[http://muppet.wikia.com/wiki/Fran_Brill Fran Brill on Muppet wikia] *{{Amg name|8476}} *[http://franbrill.com/ Official Website] {{Authority control|VIAF=169630938}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Brill, Fran | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American actor | DATE OF BIRTH = September 30th, 1946 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{The Muppets}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Brill, Fran}} [[Category:1946 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Chester, Pennsylvania]] [[Category:American film actresses]] [[Category:American television actresses]] [[Category:American voice actresses]] [[Category:Muppet performers]] [[Category:Sesame Street Muppeteers]] [[Category:Boston University alumni]] [[Category:Actresses from Pennsylvania]] {{US-screen-actor-1940s-stub}}
